solution_line_template: Mr. Deane will spend ${cost_per_liter_today}/liter x {liters_today} liters = $<<{cost_per_liter_today}*{liters_today}={cost_today}>>{cost_today} for the {liters_today} liters of gas today.

The price of the gas per liter on Friday will be ${cost_per_liter_today}/liter - ${oil_price_rollback}/liter = $<<{cost_per_liter_today}-{oil_price_rollback}={cost_per_liter_friday}>>{cost_per_liter_friday}/liter.
So, he will spend ${cost_per_liter_friday}/liter x {liters_friday} liters = $<<{cost_per_liter_friday}*{liters_friday}={cost_friday}>>{cost_friday} for the {liters_friday} liters of gas on Friday.
Thus, Mr. Deane will spend a total of ${cost_today} + ${cost_friday} = $<<{cost_today}+{cost_friday}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} for the 35 liters of gas.
